private_information: I can only move blocks labeled with vowels: A, E, I
I can only access and move the top block of any stack
I can move one block at a time and place it on the table or on another block
vowel_agent.goal: Help rearrange the blocks so that the final single stack has A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N on the table.

private_information: I can only move blocks labeled with consonants: J, K, N, D, L, B, M, H, F, G, C
I can only access and move the top block of any stack
I can move one block at a time and place it on the table or on another block
consonant_agent.goal: Help rearrange the blocks so that the final single stack has A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their observations and possible moves
I must produce the final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' partial analyses and produce a single PDDL domain and problem that encodes the initial and goal configurations and is suitable for FastDownwards.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labeled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N
Only the top block of a stack can be picked up and moved
Each agent can move only one block at a time
Vowel agent may only move vowel-labeled blocks; consonant agent may only move consonant-labeled blocks
Initial configuration: Stack1 base J with E on J, D on E, L on D, B on L, I on B, H on I. Stack2 base K with N on K, M on N, A on M, F on A, G on F, C on G
Initial explicit relations: J on table, K on table, E on J, D on E, L on D, B on L, I on B, H on I, N on K, M on N, A on M, F on A, G on F, C on G
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on table

analyze.system_prompt: You are the vowel-specialized analyst. Produce a concise structured analysis describing which vowel blocks you can currently move, which stacks those vowels are at the top of (if any), the legal move types you can perform (pick and place rules), and any local constraints or opportunities you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Your output should allow a coordinator to integrate your knowledge into a full planning representation.
analyze.prompt: Agent role: vowel_agent. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Private facts: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a structured analysis listing for each vowel block whether it is currently movable (top of a stack), its current support relation, possible target placements you can perform immediately, and any assumptions or unknowns you require the orchestrator to resolve.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the consonant-specialized analyst. Produce a concise structured analysis describing which consonant blocks you can currently move, which stacks those consonants are at the top of (if any), the legal move types you can perform (pick and place rules), and any local constraints or opportunities you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Your output should allow a coordinator to integrate your knowledge into a full planning representation.
analyze.prompt: Agent role: consonant_agent. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Private facts: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a structured analysis listing for each consonant block whether it is currently movable (top of a stack), its current support relation, possible target placements you can perform immediately, and any assumptions or unknowns you require the orchestrator to resolve.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the two agents' analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encodes the blocksworld manipulation task. The PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Keep the actions of the two agents logically distinct in the domain if agent-specific action distinctions are needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You receive the vowel agent analysis: {partial_vowel_analysis} and the consonant agent analysis: {partial_consonant_analysis}. Build a full PDDL domain and problem that represent the initial stacking relations and the goal stacking relations specified in the public information. The domain should include clear predicates for on, on-table, clear, holding if needed, and actions that respect the single-top-block and agent-type constraints (vowel-only and consonant-only movers). Target the FastDownwards solver compatibility. Output a PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> and a PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem>.
